Hello everyone,

I am a student just starting out with C# and VS (Express 2012) and am working on a small assignment part of which i need to send Keystrokes to the system. I find it quite difficult getting my head around the Windows API sendinput and was very happy when I found this wrapper.

Would somebody be so kind to talk me through how to import this into my project in VS2012?

Thank you in advance.

regards

I have figured it out thank you, Just in case somebody is looking for the same thing i will break it down into steps that I did:
  1. Extract the InputSimulator contents somewhere sensible like your project URL
  2. In Visual Studio Click Project->Add Reference and browse to the InputSimulator DLL file
  3. add the WindowsInput Namespace to the project by adding using WindowsInput;
thanks for the great wrapper :)
